exclusion: Remove Smart Switch from an existing Z‐Wave network: 1. Installed Micro Smart Dimmer, and connect Micro Smart Dimmer to an AC‐ input power source. 2. Let the primary controller of existing Z‐Wave network into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual). 3. Press the Z‐Wave button. 4. If the remove failed, please repeat the process from step 2
inclusion: Include Smart Dimmer into an existing Z‐Wave network: 1. Install Micro Smart Dimmer, and connect Micro Smart Dimmer to an AC‐input power source. 2. Let the primary controller of existing Z‐Wave network into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual). 3. Press the Z‐Wave button. 4. If the Learning failed, please repeat the process from step 2.
label: DSC19
overview: The Aeon Labs Micro Smart Dimmer (2nd Edition) is a scene multilevel switch device based on Z‐wave enhanced slave library V4.55.00.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Make Micro Smart Dimmer 2nd Edition Blink
parameters.description: The LSB defines the total time the device need to blink.
parameters.overview: This is a double byte value. The LSB defines the total time the device need to blink. The value if set in seconds. The MSB defines the on/off interval of the blinking. The unit is 0.1 s.

parameters.label: Current Overload Protection
parameters.description: Load will be closed when current more that 2.7A and time more than 2 minutes

parameters.label: Notification on Status Change
parameters.description: Send load notification to associated devices
parameters.overview: Parameter to Enable to send notification to associated devices (Group 1) when the state of Micro Smart Dimmer's load changed

parameters.label: Sending a Report triggered by min change of value
parameters.description: Automated sending of a Report triggered by minimal change of value.
parameters.overview: Parameter to Enable/Disable automated sending of a Report triggered by minimal change of value.

parameters.label: Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
parameters.description: The value represents the minimum change in Wattage for a Report to be sent.

parameters.label: Minimum Change to send Report (%)
parameters.description: The minimum change in Watage Percent for a report to be sent.
parameters.overview: The value represents the minimum change in Watage Percent for a report to be sent.

parameters.label: Reports for Group 1
parameters.description: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1
parameters.overview: The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters. The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1.

parameters.label: Reports for Group 2
parameters.description: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2
parameters.overview: The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters. The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1.

parameters.label: Reports for Group 3
parameters.description: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3
parameters.overview: The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters. The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1.

parameters.label: Interval to send out reports of group 1
Interval to send out reports of group 2
Interval to send out reports of group 3
Turn External Button Mode
parameters.description: Parameter to set External button type

associations.label: Target for automatic reports
associations.overview: According to the info in de nodeXX.xml file, this group doesn't exist for this device. - It doesn't work.
